alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Hardin; Webster; Wright (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 4:56AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Hardin, central Webster, southwestern Wright and Hamilton Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 456 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Fort Dodge, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail and additional rainfall up to one inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Locations impacted include... Fort Dodge, Webster City, Clarion, Jewell Junction, Big Wall Lake, Dayton, Stratford, Coalville, Otho, Ellsworth, Stanhope, Lehigh, Duncombe, Callender, Williams, Harcourt, Blairsburg, Kamrar, Woolstock and Buckeye. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 134 and 151. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
